title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

vmassol - (10:19): good morning all  
vmassol - (10:20): @lucaa you broke one REST test on trunk, I'm fixing it  
lucaa - (10:20): good morning charlie. What did I break? link, please  
vmassol - (10:21): tmortagne: checkstyle violations http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-core-2.2/103/console  
vmassol - (10:22): lucaa: don't worry it's because the test wastoo fragile  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:22  
lucaa - (10:22): so I didn't break it, it just broke itself  
vmassol - (10:22): yep :)  
lucaa - (10:22): ok  
vmassol - (10:22): but it shows we're not checking functional tests enough  
vmassol - (10:23): (I had some tests I had broken that have stayed broken for several days, bad bad :( )  
vmassol - (10:23): we need to find out a better way to have less hudson mails so that we look at them  
vmassol - (10:23): tmortagne: I think you broke these: http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/674/testReport/  
vmassol - (10:24): (possibly with the id generation)  
tmortagne - (10:24): vmassol: i seen tham but they don't seems to be related to header ids...  
tmortagne - (10:24): them  
tmortagne - (10:25): ha there is new ones actually  
tmortagne - (10:25): AdministratioTest is ai think  
tmortagne - (10:26): that's weird checkstyle don't want the </quote> in the comment  
vmassol - (10:27): you could use {@code …}  
tmortagne - (10:27): what's weird is that i'ts not new, it used to work with the previous comment  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:28): Good morning, re hudson mail: I have my mail client garbaging all of the "back to normal/stable" mail and the generic mail which says "something" broke, maybe a script or something could do that at the server side.  
vmassol - (10:28): CalebJamesDeLisl: it's us that decided to send these mails :)  
vmassol - (10:29): (we've checked the checkbox to do that)  
vmassol - (10:29): AFAIR  
vmassol - (10:29): (at least for the back to normal)  
tmortagne - (10:29): hmm lokks like it's a Eclipse plugin bug  
vmassol - (10:30): you think the "back to normal" isn't needed?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:30): Well, they're not garbaged they are put in the Hudson-garbage folder ;)  
sdumitriu - (10:30): Hi nickless  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:31): Maybe it is needed but then I can't pick through everything it sends, in a perfect world it would send the names of the tests which broke so we don't have to follow links.  
plunden left at 10:32 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:35): \*Running AdministrationTest locally, since I wrote the tests which are breaking I should have a reasonable chance of debugging it.  
vmassol - (10:40): hmmm  
vmassol - (10:40): http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/674/testReport/org.xwiki.rest.it/WikisResourceTest/testPages/  
vmassol - (10:40): lists several Main.WebHome  
vmassol - (10:40): I wonder why  
vmassol - (10:41): asking fabio  
tmortagne - (10:45): vmassol: there is several Main.WebHome  
vmassol - (10:45): ah?  
tmortagne - (10:45): translations  
vmassol - (10:45): oh yes  
tmortagne - (10:46): but that's not the issue here  
vmassol - (10:46): I know  
vmassol - (10:46): I just didn't know why we had several Main.WebHome  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 10:54  
vmassol - (10:58): does someone know why we have these 4 tests failing on 2.2 branch: http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-2.2/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/117/testReport/ ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:58): The test failures are because . is nolonger stripped from headers when computing id.  
vmassol - (10:59): CalebJamesDeLisl: that's for the failing tests on trunk right?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:59): That for AdministrationTest on the trunk yes.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:59): (I was typing when you posted about 2.2)  
vmassol - (10:59): yep ;)  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 11:01  
xenon75 joined #xwiki at 11:06  
vmassol - (11:07): hmm can you guys access http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration ?  
vmassol - (11:08): CalebJamesDeLisl: could you give me the URL where you've documented the new registration?  
vmassol - (11:09): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/AdministrationApplication  
lucaa - (11:09): vmassol: no, not really. It's been "Loading..." for a while now  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:10): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/AdministrationApplication#HVerified20Registration20Page20Since2022M2  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:14): re AdminGuide.Configuration: ?viewer=code works.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:14): I'm blaming jython until I see more information...  
sdumitriu left at 11:15 (Ping timeout: 258 seconds  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:15): Never mind, dev:Drafts.DynamicCustomMapping  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:15): works  
vmassol - (11:16): CalebJamesDeLisl: on http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/AdministrationApplication  
vmassol - (11:16): there's a section named "Activating Captchas"  
vmassol - (11:16): there's a screenshot there  
vmassol - (11:16): but it doesn't have a captcha  
vmassol - (11:16): that looks strange  
vmassol - (11:16): :)  
vmassol - (11:17): (it's also pretty big and has no outline as we do in other places to make it look nicer)  
vmassol - (11:17): maybe it was meant to be located in the section above?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:17): Ahh yes, that's because I'm using % instead of px  
vmassol - (11:18): I think we could have a single screenshot in the top level section related to registration  
vmassol - (11:18): and have the captch shown on that screenshot  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:18): I will upload a new picture. Another thing on my todo list is a javascript button for getting a new captcha when jcaptcha sends something impossible.  
vmassol - (11:18): that screen is avail in the Release notes btw  
vmassol - (11:18): \*screenshot  
vmassol - (11:18): ah yes good idea  
vmassol - (11:18): although a refresh is good too  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:19): Cool, I'll just reference it and save db space.  
vmassol - (11:19): hmm  
vmassol - (11:19): I don't think we should do that  
vmassol - (11:19): I prefer to expensive solution  
vmassol - (11:19): s/to/the/  
vmassol - (11:20): since release notes can be moved, removed, etc  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:20): Ok, it's not my database.  
vmassol - (11:20): :)  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:20  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:21): AdminGuide.Configuration loaded.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:22): One python exception rendering xwiki.cfg  
vmassol - (11:28): hmm from the logs seems someone is hitting us with lots of these:2010-03-24 11:22:42,843 [http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/LuceneSearch?text=LUCENE+SEARCH&x=0&y=0] ERROR lucene.SearchResults            - Error getting search result  
vmassol - (11:28): maybe that's why it's slow  
tmortagne - (11:31): CalebJamesDeLisl: do you know why http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/675/testReport/com.xpn.xwiki.it.selenium/AdministrationTest/testAddConfigurableApplicationInExistingSection/ is failing exactly ? it seems related to configurable applications  
tmortagne - (11:31): basically: what was the real header for HCustomizeMainTestConfigurable ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:31): yes, it's because . is nolonger being stripped from the header id.  
tmortagne - (11:32): ok so it's HCustomizeMain.TestConfigurable ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:32): Yes, It that's intentional then I'll change the test.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:33): s/It/if/  
sdumitriu - (11:33): nickless: Ping  
tmortagne - (11:33): CalebJamesDeLisl: yes it's intentional, oldIdGenerator was removing characters valid in ids saying that it was following specs  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:34): Ok, I'll change the test then.  
tmortagne - (11:34): ok thanks, i was going to fix it since i broke it, it was just a question ;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:35): I have the code right in front of me, no pb.  
tmortagne - (11:35): ok  
vmassol - (11:35): xwiki.org is being restarted  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 11:37  
sdumitriu - (11:38): jvdrean: What's XSALBATROSS-74 ?  
jvdrean - (11:39): sdumitriu: I noticed there had been a modification since the last albatross release, without associated JIRA  
jvdrean - (11:39): http://svnsearch.org/svnsearch/repos/XWIKI/search?path=%2Fplatform%2Fskins%2Ftrunk%2Falbatross  
sdumitriu - (11:41): Ah, right  
sdumitriu - (11:41): This is what broke the ?xpage=code  
sdumitriu - (11:41): Vincent complained about it  
mflorea left at 11:45 (Quit: Leaving.  
rstavro joined #xwiki at 11:45  
jvdrean - (11:49): Hi CalebJamesDeLisl, any idea why these tests fail ? http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/674/testReport/  
vmassol - (11:50): jvdrean: because of header id change of yesterday apparently  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:50): Yes, running the (altered) tests locally now.  
vmassol - (11:51): btw this proves that change is a breaking change  
vmassol - (11:51): (tmortagne)  
vmassol - (11:51): it should go in the release notes  
jvdrean - (11:52): vmassol: right, I should read irc more :)  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 12:31  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:31): Hmm, never heard of it, I learned regex using sed.  
vmassol - (12:31): test  
vmassol - (12:31): !news  
tmortagne - (12:31): CalebJamesDeLisl: i'm not using regexp  
vmassol - (12:31): bot seems ok  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:32): Yea, looking at the javadoc, looks a lot more strait forward.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:32): (BitSet javadoc)  
tmortagne - (12:33): it's good when you dealing only whit unique chars, but the real reason is that i'm using URLCodec.encodeUrl to encode not allowed characters  
nickless - (12:42): sdumitriu, pong  
sdumitriu - (12:48): Hi nickless  
sdumitriu - (12:48): Question for XABLOG-99  
sdumitriu - (12:48): Why do you do replace('+', '%20')?  
nickless - (12:50): otherwise there is a problem when categories with space in name  
sdumitriu - (12:50): Where?  
nickless - (12:50): some of the links doesnt work well  
nickless - (12:50): in the list of categories  
nickless - (12:51): let me see, I can say exactly what happens  
sdumitriu - (12:52): Technically + and %20 should behave the same, that's why I'm asking  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 12:57  
nickless - (13:03): ah, now I remember, othrewise adding a subcategory doesnt work  
sdumitriu - (13:04): In the ManageCategories page?  
flaviusolaru left at 13:05 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
nickless - (13:05): zes  
nickless - (13:05): yes  
nickless - (13:11): but I admit that I should have fixed the source of this error instead...  
sdumitriu - (13:14): nickless: Don't spend more time on XABLOG-99  
nickless - (13:16): I don't  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 13:18  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:46  
sdumitriu - (13:51): Yes, lots of improvements  
plunden1 - (13:52): Hi. For some reason XWiki isn't importing pages containing just groovy code. Seems that XWiki is skipping those pages. Is that to be expected?  
sdumitriu - (13:52): No  
tmortagne - (13:53): plunden1: what do you mean by "pages containing just groovy code" ? is it valid xml file representing a wiki page with groovy in the <content> part ?  
Denis left #xwiki at 13:54  
plunden1 - (13:57): tmortagne: Yes, the pages containing groovy code seem to be valid.  
tmortagne - (13:57): do you have anything in the log ?  
tmortagne - (13:58): how did you created this page ? is it a previous export ?  
plunden1 - (13:59): Oh, seems that I found the bug.  
tmortagne - (13:59): looks like group edition is broken in hudson tests  
tmortagne - (13:59): (at least in hudson, i did not trying it yet)  
tmortagne - (14:00): and it's doe snot seems to be a random failure  
plunden1 - (14:00): tmortagne: We are extracting the .xml files from .xar to svn with a custom script.  
plunden1 - (14:01): And vice versa, building the package.xml on the fly.  
tmortagne - (14:02): plunden1: what bug did you found ?  
plunden1 - (14:02): The bug is in our script, where it is creating package.xml.  
tmortagne - (14:03): ok, btw there is a maven plugin to create xar packages  
tmortagne - (14:03): see http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-tools/trunk/xwiki-xar-plugin/  
tmortagne - (14:03): you can reuse it or see how package.xml is created  
plunden1 - (14:07): tmortagne: Thanks for the tips.  
silviar - (14:07): jvdrean: Hi! Maybe you can use the color theme wizard and annotations documentation drafts for the release notes  
silviar - (14:07): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/Annotations  
silviar - (14:07): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/NewColorThemeWizard  
vmassol - (14:08): CalebJamesDeLisl: I think we need to improve http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Registration  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:08): What did you have in mind?  
vmassol - (14:09): I can think of several things:  
vmassol - (14:09): - Remove XWiki.RegistrationConfig name, it's too  technical  
vmassol - (14:10): - have a single save (as it's done for other pages) or if several then we need to rethink the UI and maybe have a different admin page  
vmassol - (14:10): - I'm not sure about the online help  
vmassol - (14:10): (and it's not consistent with the rest which have no help)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:11): Which direction would you favor going in, toward more help or less?  
vmassol - (14:11): I'm not sure  
vmassol - (14:11): the pb is  
vmassol - (14:11): to maintain it  
vmassol - (14:11): is it maintained in one place?  
vmassol - (14:11): (haven't checked)  
vmassol - (14:12): is it translated in several languages?  
vmassol - (14:13): in principle the idea of having more help in the default XE is good  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:13): It's in the svn repository, I just went to the bother of copying whats in the repo into the xwiki.org help page, but that should be just an include when the ApplicationSheet is syntax2.0  
rstavro left at 14:14 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:14): It's not translated but I found myself reading the code to determine what some of the parameters meant and I didn't think that was right.  
vmassol - (14:14): I think I'd prefer inline help as a general strategy too  
vmassol - (14:14): (ie little question mark icons next to fields)  
vmassol - (14:15): which pops up something  
vmassol - (14:15): in any case we need to discuss this on the list  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:15): So a js popup.  
vmassol - (14:15): to decide of a global strategy  
vmassol - (14:15): and then start moving everything to it  
vmassol - (14:15): the home page also has too much info IMO  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:16): In the mean time do you want me to pull the help out?  
vmassol - (14:16): oh no  
vmassol - (14:16): we need to decide what we want for the future first before doing anytihng  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:17): Ok. I should explain why there are multiple buttons and the big header.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:17): It's a technical limitation because one form cannot post to multiple documents.  
vmassol - (14:17): I understand from a technical POV  
vmassol - (14:17): I'm placing myself from a user POV here  
vmassol - (14:17): as a user I don't even want to know about something called XWiki.RegistrationConfig if I don't have to  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:18): The header is there because other applications might want to add to that page and I thought it was helpful to seperate them.  
vmassol - (14:18): what you've done looks very cool though  
vmassol - (14:18): I think it  just needs some streamlining whatever this means  
vmassol - (14:18): so UX person to go over it  
rstavro joined #xwiki at 14:19  
jvdrean - (14:19): silviar: I can use some help with the release notes, feel free to edit them  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:20): I had intended to put a button at the bottom for saving everything, but it would be a Javascript hack.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:21): Again, I think removing the heading would cause the save button to be confusing and out of place.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:21): s/Again//  
vmassol - (14:21): what you are saying I guess  
vmassol - (14:21): is that the 2 notions on this page are different  
vmassol - (14:22): and shouldn't be together  
vmassol - (14:22): so maybe it's 2 different tabs in the same Registration config page? Or 2 different admin sections? or....  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:22): I guess the best thing would be if everything was in RegistrationConfig and nothing in XWikiPreferences.  
vmassol - (14:22): or that  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:23): (little steps)  
vmassol - (14:23): I'm still worried about upgradability  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:23): Tabs might work, but they might also introduce additional confusion depending on what programs were added.  
vmassol - (14:23): right now is that config page listed in the upgrade pages?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:24): I didn't put it there, but I will, thanks for mentioning it.  
vmassol - (14:24): yes because right now people doing upgrades will loose their configs  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:24): This whole upgrade thing is a big hack as far as I can see.  
vmassol - (14:24): even if it's written down they'll still loose their configs I guess  
vmassol - (14:25): because they're used to that single XWikiPrefrences page  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:25): What we need is a way to load in old parameters to new objects.  
vmassol - (14:25): and they'll probably not read the doc  
vmassol - (14:25): what I suggested  
vmassol - (14:25): for now  
vmassol - (14:25): was to have a common naming shceme  
vmassol - (14:25): for all config pages  
vmassol - (14:26): and the in the doc say to users: exclude pages with names \*.\*Config  
vmassol - (14:26): or \*.\*Properties if we want to follow what currentle xists  
vmassol - (14:26): oops  
flaviusolaru left at 14:26 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
vmassol - (14:26): s/Properties/Prefrences/  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:27): How hard do you think it would be to do this right? get the last version of documents which have "upgradable" objects.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:27): Load in parameters from the last version of the object.  
vmassol - (14:27): we need to define what is right then first  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:27): I suppose we do.  
vmassol - (14:28): we could also introduce the notion of configuration page type (doc type)  
vmassol - (14:28): and make that notion known in the importer to warn users  
lucaa - (14:28): guys, is there any documentation on xwiki.org about how to prepare wiki pages (in a .xar) to be committed to svn? or how to prepare a patch for such an application? (remove tags object, reset version, etc)  
vmassol - (14:28): ie have a Preferences class acting as a tagging object  
vmassol - (14:28): or something like this  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:29): Well I did a similar thing with ConfigurableClass.  
vmassol - (14:29): anyway I don't have the solution but someone need to think about this and make some proposal I guess  
vmassol - (14:29): looks like Document Type to me  
rstavro left at 14:30 (  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:30): I don't understand what you mean by DocumentType.  
nickless left at 14:30 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
vmassol - (14:30): jvdrean: any link re Document Type?  
vmassol - (14:31): (can't find it in the design space)  
nickless joined #xwiki at 14:31  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:32): Quick google shows something about a plugin.  
vmassol - (14:32): basically it means the ability to give a type to documents  
vmassol - (14:33): blog posts, normal text doc, faq doc, etc  
vmassol - (14:33): and have default display sheets for each type  
vmassol - (14:33): and have the ability to create new docs based on the type wanted  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:34): If I were to design this I would create a class and query for documents containing instances of that class. Each object of that class would have a list field which pointed to objects which should have values loaded from the older version.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:34): So like extending Document.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:35): My thinking is why not keep the configuration close to the code which uses it, do it's not a special document as much as it is a special object attached to that document.  
vmassol - (14:36): it's cleaner if it's a doc IMO  
vmassol - (14:36): since it allows for ex to have a display sheet for it  
vmassol - (14:36): so it's self-contained  
vmassol - (14:36): but then I haven't really thought about it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:37): But then the code itself must know where to find it's configuration, and it must have defaults in case there is no configuration...  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:38): It ends up looking a bit like the 'private static final String SOME\_CLASS = "XWiki.SomeClass";' antipattern.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:38): What do you think of the api change I am proposing?  
vmassol - (14:39): havne't looked yet  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:39): Document.saveAsAuthor()  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:39): set the author field to the author of the currently executing script and save if that author is permitted to edit.  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 14:42  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:46): Just sent another email about the API change, it would be nice to hear some discussion even if it is just "-1" it will at least stop me from dreaming.  
Denis joined #xwiki at 15:10  
jvdrean - (15:16): catching up, vmassol about document types:  
jvdrean - (15:17): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/OverhaulOfXWikiClassesAndObjectsManagement  
jvdrean - (15:17): http://markmail.org/message/walphzzl6dl2bqmi  
vmassol - (15:17): ah was looking for "document type" in the description ;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:21): Interesting page. I think that if we start rewriting the permissions manager, we are going to be dealing with many of these issues.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:23): I like the idea of the only permissions being read, write, execute and delete. (A clone of Unix permissions)  
bblfish - (15:36): where do I edit the html that adds the picture on the wiki profile?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:38): Let me look, I think it's javascript.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:39): Nope, it's a template.
